definition: position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: This double-degree is jointly offered by the Faculty of Arts and the Faculty of Education.
sentences.chinese: 此项双学位课程由文学院与教育学院合办。

sentences.english: Why do so many students choose the second major?
sentences.chinese: 那么为什么那么多的学生都选择了双学位呢？

sentences.english: From which source did you hear about the dual-degree EMBA program?
sentences.chinese: 您最早是从哪个渠道了解到双学位EMBA项目的？

sentences.english: they also have the double program where you can do Master's in Education.
sentences.chinese: 这里也有双学位课程，可以读教育硕士。

sentences.english: He graduated from the university with dual degrees in linguistics and diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 最后毕业时，他还拿到了语言学和外交学的双学位。

sentences.english: Therefore students must earn a minimum of 126 credits (in Mason-equivalent credits) to complete the 1+2+1 dual degree.
sentences.chinese: 因此，学生要想获得双学位，至少需要126学分。

sentences.english: She is working for her twice major in English and Economics.
sentences.chinese: 她正在修媖语俰经济双学位。

definition: (at a school) to take as an elective/an elective/elective (subject)
doctoral degree/PhD/same as Doctor of Philosophy 哲學博士學位|哲学博士学位
master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person
